title: Ephesians Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ephesians chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ephesians Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ephesians Chapter 3.

questions.question: Who is described as the prisoner of Jesus Christ for the Gentiles?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:1 states 'For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles,' identifying Paul as the prisoner.

questions.question: What has been given to Paul to the Gentiles according to Ephesians 3:2?
options: Dispensation of the grace of God
questions.correctAnswer: Dispensation of the grace of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:2 mentions 'the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me to you-ward.'

questions.question: How was the mystery made known to Paul?
questions.correctAnswer: By revelation
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:3 explains 'How that by revelation he made known unto me the mystery.'

questions.question: True or False: The mystery of Christ was made known to men in other ages before Paul's time.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:5 states the mystery was 'not made known unto the sons of men, as it is now revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit.'

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:6, Gentiles should be what in Christ?
options: Fellowheirs and partakers of his promise
questions.correctAnswer: Fellowheirs and partakers of his promise
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:6 says 'That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ.'

questions.question: Paul says he was made a minister according to what?
options: The gift of the grace of God
questions.correctAnswer: The gift of the grace of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:7 states 'Whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God given unto me.'

questions.question: True or False: Paul considers himself greater than all saints.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:8 says Paul is 'less than the least of all saints.'

questions.question: What does Paul preach among the Gentiles?
questions.correctAnswer: The unsearchable riches of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:8 mentions preaching 'the unsearchable riches of Christ' among the Gentiles.

questions.question: What has been hidden in God from the beginning of the world?
questions.correctAnswer: The fellowship of the mystery
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:9 says the mystery 'hath been hid in God, who created all things by Jesus Christ.'

questions.question: The manifold wisdom of God is made known to whom by the church?
options: Principalities and powers in heavenly places
questions.correctAnswer: Principalities and powers in heavenly places
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:10 states 'that now unto the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God.'

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 3:12, we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of Christ Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:12 says 'In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.'

questions.question: Paul bows his knees unto whom according to Ephesians 3:14?
options: The Father of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The Father of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:14 states 'For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'That Christ may dwell in your hearts by ______;'
questions.correctAnswer: faith
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:17 says 'That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith.'

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:19, what surpasses knowledge?
questions.correctAnswer: The love of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:19 states 'to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge.'

questions.question: Who is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think?
questions.correctAnswer: Him that worketh in us
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:20 describes 'Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us.'

medium.title: Ephesians Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ephesians Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Ephesians 3, what biblical truth would you share about facing tribulations?
options: Their suffering is for the glory of others
Tribulations are meaningless and should be avoided
Believers should faint and lose hope
Trials are a sign of God's displeasure
questions.correctAnswer: Their suffering is for the glory of others
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:13 teaches that Paul’s tribulations are for the glory of the believers, encouraging perseverance in trials. This shows trials can have a purpose beyond personal hardship.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 3 teach us about the role of prayer in the believer's spiritual strength?
options: Prayer strengthens believers with might through the Spirit
Prayer is optional and not crucial for spiritual growth
Prayer only benefits pastors and apostles
Prayer is primarily for asking material blessings
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer strengthens believers with might through the Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:16 emphasizes praying to God to grant strength through the Spirit in the inner man, highlighting the vital role of prayer in spiritual empowerment.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3, what should be the motivation for preaching the gospel to Gentiles?
options: To reveal the unsearchable riches of Christ
To gain personal fame and wealth
To create division between Jews and Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: To reveal the unsearchable riches of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:8 states Paul was given grace to preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ, showing that revealing Christ’s richness is the gospel motivation.

questions.question: A believer struggles with understanding God's plan. How does Ephesians 3 describe the mystery of Christ?
options: It was hidden in past ages but now revealed by the Spirit
It is a secret only for apostles and prophets
It has always been fully understood by all men
It is irrelevant to Christian living
questions.correctAnswer: It was hidden in past ages but now revealed by the Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:5 explains that the mystery of Christ was not made known in previous ages but is now revealed to apostles and prophets by the Spirit, emphasizing God’s progressive revelation.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 3 teach about the believer's access to God?
options: We have boldness and confident access by faith in Christ
Access to God is limited to certain holy places
Believers must earn access through good works
Access is only granted to apostles
questions.correctAnswer: We have boldness and confident access by faith in Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:12 states believers have boldness and access with confidence through faith in Christ, teaching the assurance of prayer and fellowship with God.

questions.question: How does the passage in Ephesians 3 encourage believers to view their unity with Gentiles?
options: Gentiles are fellowheirs and partakers of Christ’s promise
Gentiles are outsiders with no part in God’s promises
Unity is unnecessary in the church
questions.correctAnswer: Gentiles are fellowheirs and partakers of Christ’s promise
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:6 explains the mystery that Gentiles are fellowheirs, members of the same body, and partakers of the promise in Christ, emphasizing unity and inclusion.

questions.question: What biblical virtue does Paul exemplify in describing himself as 'less than the least of all saints'?
questions.correctAnswer: Humility in service
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:8 shows Paul’s humility by calling himself the least of all saints, demonstrating the virtue of humility while serving others through God's grace.

questions.question: How can a believer apply Ephesians 3's teaching on love in daily family life?
options: Being rooted and grounded in love as Christ dwells in hearts by faith
Ignoring love and focusing on rules
questions.correctAnswer: Being rooted and grounded in love as Christ dwells in hearts by faith
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:17 encourages believers to be rooted and grounded in love with Christ dwelling in their hearts by faith, teaching love as the foundation for relationships including family.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 3, the wisdom of God is made known to spiritual rulers through the church.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:10 reveals that the manifold wisdom of God is made known to principalities and powers in heavenly places through the church, showing the church’s spiritual significance.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 3 teaches that the love of Christ is fully comprehensible by human knowledge.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:19 states that the love of Christ passes knowledge, indicating it is beyond full human comprehension, but believers can still experience it deeply.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ephesians 3 teaches that believers may be filled with all the ______ of God.
questions.correctAnswer: fulness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:19 says believers might be filled with all the fulness of God, highlighting the goal of spiritual maturity and completeness in Christ.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 3 instruct believers to respond to the grace given for ministry?
options: By faithfully preaching the gospel with God's power
By limiting the message to a select few
questions.correctAnswer: By faithfully preaching the gospel with God's power
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:7 emphasizes ministry according to the gift of grace and the effective working of God's power, encouraging faithful and empowered service.

questions.question: What is the ultimate purpose of God’s eternal plan according to Ephesians 3?
options: Glory through Christ Jesus our Lord
To create a separate church for Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: Glory through Christ Jesus our Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:11 states the eternal purpose God purposed is in Christ Jesus our Lord, pointing to God’s glory as the ultimate goal of His plan.

questions.question: In the context of Ephesians 3, what role does faith play in the believer’s relationship with God?
options: It gives boldness and confident access to God
It is unnecessary for access to God
It is only for new converts
questions.correctAnswer: It gives boldness and confident access to God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:12 teaches that faith in Christ provides believers boldness and confident access to God, underscoring faith’s central role in fellowship with God.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 3 encourage believers to understand God's power working in them?
options: God can do exceedingly abundantly above all we ask or think
God's power is limited by human ability
Believers must rely entirely on themselves
Power is only manifested in miracles
questions.correctAnswer: God can do exceedingly abundantly above all we ask or think
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:20 emphasizes God's power working within believers to do exceedingly abundantly above what we ask or think, encouraging trust in God’s limitless strength.

hard.title: Ephesians Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ephesians Chapter 3.

questions.question: In Ephesians 3:6, what is the significance of Gentiles being described as 'fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ by the gospel'?
options: It emphasizes the unity of Jews and Gentiles in salvation
It refers to the exclusive inheritance of Jewish believers
It indicates Gentiles are separate from the covenant promises
It highlights the Gentiles' role as observers only
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the unity of Jews and Gentiles in salvation
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:6 states that Gentiles are fellowheirs and partakers of the promise in Christ, emphasizing the inclusion and unity of Gentiles with Jewish believers in God's covenant blessings.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by 'the mystery' revealed to him as mentioned in Ephesians 3:3-4?
options: The inclusion of Gentiles in God's plan
The identity of the Messiah as David's son
The laws of the Mosaic covenant
questions.correctAnswer: The inclusion of Gentiles in God's plan
questions.explanation: Paul explains in Ephesians 3:3-4 that the mystery revealed to him by revelation concerns the inclusion of Gentiles as part of God's people, a truth previously hidden but now made known.

questions.question: Which role does Paul claim to have according to the gift of the grace of God in Ephesians 3:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Minister among the Gentiles
questions.explanation: Paul states in Ephesians 3:7 that he was made a minister according to the gift of God's grace to preach among the Gentiles, highlighting his apostolic mission.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 3:10 describe the purpose of the church in relation to 'principalities and powers in heavenly places'?
options: To make known the manifold wisdom of God
To overthrow the principalities and powers
questions.correctAnswer: To make known the manifold wisdom of God
questions.explanation: Verse 3:10 explains that through the church, God's manifold wisdom is displayed to the principalities and powers, revealing divine wisdom in the spiritual realm.

questions.question: What does Paul express about his own worthiness in Ephesians 3:8?
options: He considers himself less than the least of all saints
He sees himself as the greatest apostle
He believes he is equal to other apostles
He claims to be sinless and perfect
questions.correctAnswer: He considers himself less than the least of all saints
questions.explanation: In Ephesians 3:8, Paul humbly describes himself as 'less than the least of all saints,' emphasizing his unworthiness despite the grace given to him to preach.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Ephesians 3:18 with the mention of 'breadth, and length, and depth, and height'?
options: A metaphor for the Tabernacle design
questions.correctAnswer: A fourfold dimensional parallelism
questions.explanation: The fourfold mention of dimensions in Ephesians 3:18 uses parallelism to convey the immeasurable and comprehensive nature of Christ's love.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:16, what is the source of inner strength for believers?
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit of God
questions.explanation: Paul prays in 3:16 that believers would be strengthened with might by the Spirit in their inner being, indicating the Spirit as the true source of spiritual strength.

questions.question: Ephesians 3:12 mentions 'boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.' Who is 'him' referring to and what is the theological significance?
options: Christ Jesus, enabling believers direct approach to God
Moses, as mediator of the Old Covenant
The Holy Spirit, as the comforter
questions.correctAnswer: Christ Jesus, enabling believers direct approach to God
questions.explanation: The 'him' in 3:12 refers to Christ Jesus, through whom believers have confident access to God, highlighting the New Testament doctrine of direct access to God by faith in Christ.

questions.question: True or False: In Ephesians 3:5, Paul indicates that the mystery of Christ was fully known to the sons of men in previous ages.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 3:5 states the mystery was not made known to the sons of men in other ages but is now revealed to apostles and prophets by the Spirit, showing it was a new revelation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ephesians 3:20 attributes to God the ability to do 'exceeding abundantly above all that we ___ or ___.'
questions.correctAnswer: ask; think
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:20 describes God's power as exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, emphasizing His limitless ability to work in us.

questions.question: How does the concept of mystery in Ephesians 3 correlate with Old Testament prophetic literature?
options: Like Isaiah and Daniel, it reveals hidden divine plans unveiled in the New Testament
It contradicts all Old Testament prophecies
It solely focuses on Mosaic Law
questions.correctAnswer: Like Isaiah and Daniel, it reveals hidden divine plans unveiled in the New Testament
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3's mystery aligns with prophetic literature such as Isaiah and Daniel where God’s hidden plans are gradually revealed, culminating in the New Testament revelation of Gentile inclusion.

questions.question: What historical-cultural context underlies Paul's reference to being a 'prisoner of Jesus Christ' in Ephesians 3:1?
options: His imprisonment for preaching the gospel to Gentiles under Roman authority
His exile from Jerusalem by Jewish leaders
questions.correctAnswer: His imprisonment for preaching the gospel to Gentiles under Roman authority
questions.explanation: Paul’s self-identification as a prisoner (Ephesians 3:1) reflects his historical imprisonment by Roman authorities due to his missionary work among Gentiles.

questions.question: In Ephesians 3:14-15, Paul’s act of bowing his knees to the Father is an example of what biblical literary device?
options: An opening to a prayer of intercession
questions.correctAnswer: An opening to a prayer of intercession
questions.explanation: Paul’s bowing of knees in 3:14 signals the start of an intercessory prayer, a common biblical practice of petitioning God on behalf of others.

questions.question: Which phrase in Ephesians 3:9 emphasizes the cosmic scope of God's plan revealed through the church?
options: 'From the beginning of the world hath been hid in God'
'Less than the least of all saints'
'By the effectual working of his power'
questions.correctAnswer: 'From the beginning of the world hath been hid in God'
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:9 highlights the mystery hidden 'from the beginning of the world' showing the eternal and cosmic scope of God's redemptive plan revealed by the church.

questions.question: How does the theme of 'being rooted and grounded in love' in Ephesians 3:17 connect with Jesus' teachings in the Synoptic Gospels?
options: It parallels Jesus' command to love God and neighbor as the greatest commandments
It contradicts the Sermon on the Mount
It focuses only on ceremonial purity
It refers exclusively to Old Testament law observance
questions.correctAnswer: It parallels Jesus' command to love God and neighbor as the greatest commandments
questions.explanation: Paul’s emphasis on being rooted and grounded in love (3:17) echoes Jesus' teaching in Matthew 22 on love as the foundation of the law and prophets.

theological.title: Ephesians Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ephesians Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:6, what is the mystery revealed concerning the Gentiles?
options: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, of the same body, and partakers of the promise in Christ
That the Gentiles would remain separate from the promises given to Israel
That the Gentiles must first become Jews to receive God's promise
That the Gentiles were excluded from the covenant of grace
questions.correctAnswer: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, of the same body, and partakers of the promise in Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:6 reveals the new covenant mystery that Gentiles are fellowheirs and partakers of Christ's promises, consistent with Galatians 3:28, Romans 11:17-18, Colossians 3:11, and Acts 10:34-35 where Gentiles are included in God's redemptive plan.

questions.question: What does Paul claim was given to him to preach among the Gentiles in Ephesians 3:8?
options: The secrets of the kingdom of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: The unsearchable riches of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:8 states Paul was given grace to preach the unsearchable riches of Christ, paralleling Colossians 1:27, Romans 11:33, 2 Corinthians 12:7-9, and Isaiah 55:8-9 which speak of God's wisdom and riches being beyond human understanding.

questions.question: In Ephesians 3:10, what is the purpose of the church being made known to principalities and powers?
options: To reveal the manifold wisdom of God
To bring fear to heavenly beings
questions.correctAnswer: To reveal the manifold wisdom of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:10 teaches the church reveals God's manifold wisdom to spiritual beings, reflecting themes in Colossians 1:16, 1 Corinthians 2:7-10, Romans 16:27, and Isaiah 40:13-14 about God's wisdom displayed through salvation history.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:12, how do believers have boldness and access to God?
options: By the faith of Jesus Christ
By strict adherence to the law
questions.correctAnswer: By the faith of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:12 states believers have boldness through faith in Christ, consistent with Hebrews 4:16, Romans 5:1-2, Galatians 3:26-27, and John 14:6 which emphasize faith as the means of access to God.

questions.question: What is Paul’s attitude toward his sufferings for the Gentiles as expressed in Ephesians 3:13?
options: He desires believers not to faint because it is their glory
He is discouraged and wishes to stop preaching
He feels his sufferings are meaningless
He blames the Gentiles for his troubles
questions.correctAnswer: He desires believers not to faint because it is their glory
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:13 shows Paul's desire that believers not lose heart over his trials, seeing them as their glory, aligning with 2 Corinthians 12:9-10, Philippians 1:29, Romans 8:17, and Acts 9:16 where suffering for Christ is honored.

questions.question: In Ephesians 3:16, what does Paul pray the believers would receive according to the riches of God's glory?
options: Strengthened with might by His Spirit in the inner man
questions.correctAnswer: Strengthened with might by His Spirit in the inner man
questions.explanation: Paul prays for spiritual strength by the Holy Spirit in believers’ inner beings, as seen here and supported by Isaiah 40:29, Romans 15:13, 2 Timothy 1:7, and John 14:26 speaking of Spirit-empowerment for the Christian life.

questions.question: What does Paul desire concerning Christ’s presence in believers’ hearts as stated in Ephesians 3:17?
options: That Christ may dwell in their hearts by faith
That Christ may appear only in visions
That Christ may dwell in their minds only
That Christ may dwell only among the apostles
questions.correctAnswer: That Christ may dwell in their hearts by faith
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:17 expresses Paul’s desire for Christ to dwell in believers’ hearts through faith, consistent with Colossians 1:27, Romans 8:10, Galatians 2:20, and John 14:23 which affirm Christ’s indwelling presence.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:19, what surpasses knowledge and fills believers?
questions.correctAnswer: The love of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:19 teaches the love of Christ surpasses knowledge and fills believers, a concept echoed in 1 Corinthians 13:2, Romans 8:39, John 15:9, and 1 John 4:16 concerning the immeasurable and transformative nature of Christ’s love.

questions.question: What attribute of God is highlighted in Ephesians 3:20 in relation to what He is able to do?
options: He is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think
He is limited by human ability
He only works within natural laws
questions.correctAnswer: He is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:20 emphasizes God's omnipotence and abundant power, consistent with Jeremiah 32:17, Matthew 19:26, Psalm 147:5, and Luke 1:37 portraying God's limitless ability to fulfill His purposes beyond human expectation.

questions.question: What eternal purpose is referred to in Ephesians 3:11?
options: The eternal purpose which God purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord
The establishment of a physical kingdom on earth
The preservation of the Jewish law only
The destruction of all Gentile nations
questions.correctAnswer: The eternal purpose which God purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:11 speaks of God's eternal plan realized in Christ, aligned with Isaiah 46:10, Romans 8:28-30, 2 Timothy 1:9, and Revelation 13:8 which reveal God's sovereign eternal purpose through Jesus Christ.

questions.question: In Ephesians 3:14-15, to whom does Paul bow his knees in prayer, and why is this significant?
options: The Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, from whom all family in heaven and earth is named
The angels in heaven who oversee the church
The apostles who teach the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: The Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, from whom all family in heaven and earth is named
questions.explanation: Paul bows to the Father, recognizing God's universal fatherhood over all creation, reflecting themes in Genesis 1:1, Psalm 103:19, Matthew 6:9, and 1 Corinthians 8:6 that affirm God as the ultimate source and father of all families and beings.

questions.question: What is described as being 'hidden in God' from the beginning of the world in Ephesians 3:9?
questions.correctAnswer: The fellowship of the mystery
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:9 reveals the mystery of the gospel fellowship was hidden in God but now revealed, corresponding with Romans 16:25-26, Colossians 1:26-27, Isaiah 45:3, and Daniel 2:28 where God discloses hidden truths in His time.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 3:7, by what means was Paul made a minister?
options: According to the gift of the grace of God given by the effectual working of His power
Through a human appointment by the church leaders
By fulfilling the Mosaic law perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: According to the gift of the grace of God given by the effectual working of His power
questions.explanation: Paul describes his ministry as enabled by God's grace and power, consistent with 1 Corinthians 15:10, 2 Timothy 1:9-10, Acts 20:24, and Philippians 3:7-8 emphasizing divine calling and empowerment rather than human merit.

questions.question: What dimensions does Paul mention in Ephesians 3:18 that believers may comprehend with all saints?
questions.correctAnswer: Breadth, length, depth, and height
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:18 uses spatial dimensions metaphorically for the vastness of Christ's love, similar to Job 11:7-8, Isaiah 40:12, John 3:16, and Psalm 103:11 illustrating God's immeasurable love and wisdom.

questions.question: What is the ultimate doxology Paul gives in Ephesians 3:21?
options: Unto Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end
Praise be to the angels and saints
Glory to human wisdom and knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Unto Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end
questions.explanation: Ephesians 3:21 concludes with eternal glory given to God through Christ in the church, agreeing with Revelation 5:13, Psalm 115:1, Romans 11:36, and 1 Timothy 1:17 emphasizing God's eternal glory and worship.
